description: Game setup complete with 6 players
Blood on the Clocktower game started with 6 players
Setup phase complete, transitioning to Night phase
Storyteller → Olivia, Emily, John, Susan, Daniel, Michael: Night has begun on round 1.
Storyteller → Emily: Three good roles not in play are Mayor, Virgin, Drunk and your minion(s) are John
Storyteller → John: The Demon is Emily.

Storyteller → John: You have poisoned Daniel for the night and next day. Your reasoning: Daniel is likely a powerful Good role given the player count, so poisoning him will neutralize a potential threat to our Evil team. Avoiding Emily since she's my Demon teammate.

metadata.private_reasoning: Daniel is likely a powerful Good role given the player count, so poisoning him will neutralize a potential threat to our Evil team. Avoiding Emily since she's my Demon teammate.

description: Storyteller → Olivia: 1 of your 2 alive neighbors are evil.

Storyteller → Michael: Yes, one of Olivia and Emily is the Demon. Your reasoning: I'm choosing the first two players in seating order to start gathering information about potential demons. This will help me begin to narrow down who might be evil.

metadata.private_reasoning: I'm choosing the first two players in seating order to start gathering information about potential demons. This will help me begin to narrow down who might be evil.

description: Olivia updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Round 1 Night: Received Empath information that 1 of my 2 alive neighbors (Emily and Michael) is evil
• My neighbors are Emily (to my right) and Michael (to my left) - one is evil, one is good
• Need to determine which neighbor is evil through observation and claims
• Game setup: 3 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 1 Minion, 1 Demon (6 total players)

**Strategy:**
• Watch Emily and Michael's behavior during Day 1 - look for suspicious voting patterns or claims
• Be cautious about revealing my Empath information too early - it makes me a target for evil players
• Pay attention to who my evil neighbor tries to defend or attack - they may coordinate with other evil players
• Consider revealing my information strategically if it helps secure an execution of my evil neighbor
• Build trust with confirmed good players while gathering more information about the evil team composition

description: Emily updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**Game State Summary:**
• Round 1, Night phase - 6 players alive (Olivia, Emily, John, Susan, Daniel, Michael)
• I am Emily, the Imp (Demon) on the Evil team
• My minion is John
• Three good roles not in play: Mayor, Virgin, Drunk
• Setup: 3 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 1 Minion, 1 Demon

**Strategic Action Points:**
• Coordinate with John (my minion) to establish a cover story and avoid suspicion
• Choose tonight's kill target carefully - avoid John, target someone who might have strong investigative abilities
• Blend in during day phase by participating in discussions without drawing attention as evil
• If nominated, defend myself by pointing suspicion toward good players
• Monitor voting patterns to identify potential Fortune Tellers or other investigative roles

description: John updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**History Summary:**
• I am John, the Poisoner on the Evil team
• Emily is my Demon teammate (the Imp)
• Night 1: I poisoned Daniel, reasoning he's likely a powerful Good role that needs neutralizing
• Game setup: 6 players total (3 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 1 Minion, 1 Demon)
• Player order: Olivia, Emily, John, Susan, Daniel, Michael

**Strategic Action Points:**
• Coordinate secretly with Emily (Demon) to identify and eliminate key Good roles like investigative characters
• Use poisoning strategically on suspected powerful Townsfolk (Fortune Teller, Empath, Chef) to feed them false information
• Blend in during day discussions by appearing helpful to Good team while subtly misdirecting investigations
• Protect Emily's identity at all costs - vote against her nominations only when absolutely necessary for cover
• Target players who might have received accurate information about our Evil team composition

description: Susan updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**Game Summary:**
• Round 1, Night phase just began
• All 6 players alive: Olivia, Emily, John, Susan (me), Daniel, Michael
• I am Recluse (Good team) - might register as Evil/Minion/Demon to other players
• No information or events have occurred yet

**Strategy:**
• Stay quiet about being Recluse early - revealing could help Evil team coordinate false information
• Pay attention to information roles (Washerwoman, Librarian, Investigator, Chef, Empath, Fortune Teller) and see if any might have detected me as Evil
• If someone claims I'm Evil based on their ability, don't immediately counter-claim as it could be true due to Recluse ability
• Look for Evil players trying to use my Recluse registering against me - they might push too hard on "evidence" 
• Focus on finding the real Demon through process of elimination and behavioral analysis rather than relying solely on mechanical information

description: Daniel updated their notes

metadata.notes:
**History Summary:**
• Round 1 Night just began
• All players alive: Olivia, Emily, John, Susan, Daniel (me), Michael
• I am Slayer (Good team) - can once per game publicly choose a player during day; if Demon, they die
• No information or actions taken yet

**Strategy Action Points:**
• Wait for day phase to gather information from other players' claims before using Slayer ability
• Listen carefully to all character claims and look for inconsistencies that might reveal Evil players
• Pay attention to voting patterns and who supports/opposes nominations
• Use Slayer ability only when confident about Demon identity - it's one-shot and crucial for Good team victory
• Focus on building trust with confirmed Good players while identifying suspicious behavior from potential Evil players

description: Michael updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Round 1 Night: As Fortune Teller, I learned that one of Olivia or Emily is the Demon
• This means the Demon is either Olivia or Emily - need to investigate both carefully
• There's also a good player who registers as Demon to my ability, so this could be false information
• Need to determine which of Olivia/Emily is actually the Demon vs the false positive
• No executions or deaths yet, all 6 players still alive

**Strategy Points:**
• Focus investigation on Olivia and Emily to determine which is the real Demon
• Use Fortune Teller ability on different player pairs to gather more information
• Watch for suspicious behavior from Olivia and Emily during day discussions
• Be cautious about revealing my Fortune Teller identity too early to avoid being targeted
• Work to build trust with confirmed good players while identifying the evil team
